raw: * The Toolbar class is the main part of the toolbar widget.
* It can handle added {@link Button}s, {@link CheckBox}es, {@link RadioButton}s
* and {@link Separator}s in its {@link #add} method. The {@link #addSpacer} method
* adds a spacer at the current toolbar position. This means that the widgets
* added after the method call of {@link #addSpacer} are aligned to the right of
* the toolbar.
* For more details on the documentation of the toolbar widget, take a look at the
* documentation of the {@link qx.ui.toolbar}-Package.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The Toolbar class is the main part of the toolbar widget. It can handle added {@link Button}s, {@link CheckBox}es, {@link RadioButton}s and {@link Separator}s in its {@link #add} method. The {@link #addSpacer} method adds a spacer at the current toolbar position. This means that the widgets added after the method call of {@link #addSpacer} are aligned to the right of the toolbar. For more details on the documentation of the toolbar widget, take a look at the documentation of the {@link qx.ui.toolbar}-Package.

raw: * Responsible for returning the next item to remove. In It checks the
* priorities added by {@link #setRemovePriority}. If all priorized widgets
* already excluded, it takes the widget added at last.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The widget which should be removed next.
*   If null is returned, no widget is available to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Responsible for returning the next item to remove. In It checks the priorities added by {@link #setRemovePriority}. If all priorized widgets already excluded, it takes the widget added at last.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The widget which should be removed next.
   If null is returned, no widget is available to remove.
@return.description:
The widget which should be removed next.
   If null is returned, no widget is available to remove.

raw: * The removal of the toolbar items is priority based. You can change these
* priorities with this method. The higher a priority, the earlier it will
* be excluded. Remember to use every priority only once! If you want
* override an already set priority, use the override parameter.
* Keep in mind to only use already added items.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The item to give the priority.
* @param priority {Integer} The priority, higher means removed earlier.
* @param override {Boolean} true, if the priority should be overridden.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The removal of the toolbar items is priority based. You can change these priorities with this method. The higher a priority, the earlier it will be excluded. Remember to use every priority only once! If you want override an already set priority, use the override parameter. Keep in mind to only use already added items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The item to give the priority.
@param.description: The item to give the priority.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: priority {Integer} The priority, higher means removed earlier.
@param.description: The priority, higher means removed earlier.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: override {Boolean} true, if the priority should be overridden.
@param.description: true, if the priority should be overridden.

*   to the spacer is needed to remove this spacer from the layout.

raw: * Returns the index position of the given widget if it is
* a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1.
* This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
* (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.Widget} the widget to query for
* @return {Integer} The index position or -1 when
*   the given widget is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given widget if it is a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} the widget to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.

raw: * Adds a new child widget.
* The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager
* used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class
* documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to add.
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

raw: * Add a child widget at the specified index

* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add
* @param index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child widget at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

raw: * Add a widget before another already inserted widget

* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add
* @param before {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget before the new widget will be inserted.
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a widget before another already inserted widget This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.description: Widget before the new widget will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.
